author: BBC News Mundo
title: viernes 29
text:
El Nuevo Herald Horóscopo para viernes 29 de diciembre 29 de diciembre de 2023,
Venus salpica de encanto tu vida y te verás rodeado de una magia muy especial. Se enfatiza para ti ahora todo lo que sea arte, cultura y belleza. Todo lo exótico, lo que sea fuera de lo común, llamará poderosamente tu atención. Viajes, especialmente al extranjero, prometen ser muy placenteros y divertidos bajo este aspecto. Números de suerte: 14, 8, 21.
Tauro
(19 de abril - 19 de mayo)
Se intensifican las relaciones amorosas bajo el tránsito de Venus, tu planeta regente, por tu casa octava. Irás ahora más allá del puro contacto sexual y te sentirás unido espiritualmente a la persona que amas. Toda relación que comience bajo este aspecto será intensa y dejará una huella profunda en tu corazón. Números de suerte: 10, 44, 36.
Géminis
(20 de mayo - 19 de junio)
Entras en un periodo donde solo habrá espacio para la paz en tu vida. Venus, en tu sexta casa, derrama toda su energía positiva sobre tus relaciones amorosas, relaciones de trabajo y hasta las relaciones con tus enemigos. Podrás expresar tus sentimientos claramente a tu pareja, creando una atmósfera de armonía a tu alrededor. Números de suerte: 33, 4, 26.
Cáncer
(20 de junio - 21 de julio)
Venus, el planeta del amor, entra hoy en tu sexta casa del zodiaco llevando a enfrentar aquellos problemas que han quedado sin resolver en lo que concierne a tus relaciones personales. Buen momento para poner las cosas en claro y llegar a acuerdos razonables para ambas partes. Trabajo y profesión estarán bien aspectados. Números de suerte: 1, 26, 19.
Leo
(22 de julio - 21 de agosto)
Leo, tú ahora estás de plácemes con la entrada de Venus en tu casa de la diversión y el amor. Todo tipo de actividad social está favorecida bajo este aspecto. Los niños jugarán un papel importante en tu vida. Se enfatizan favorablemente las actividades creativas. En el amor, te amarán tal y como eres con virtudes y defectos. Números de suerte: 25, 7, 10.
Continuar leyendo la historia Virgo
(22 de agosto - 21 de sept.)
Venus, el planeta del amor, la diversión y la belleza, entra en tu casa cuarta, la del hogar y te imanta de energía para hacer de ti el mejor anfitrión o anfitriona. Excelente periodo para compartir con familiares y amistades. Las relaciones con tus padres (si los tienes cerca) mejoran notablemente. Buen momento para hacer cambios a tu hogar. Números de suerte: 3, 40, 15.
Libra
(22 de sept. - 22 de oct.)
Buen momento para compartir con amistades y simplemente pasarla bien. Realizarás quien verdaderamente te quiere ya que te lo demostrarán. No dejes nada a la imaginación y tú también expresa tu amor. Podrás disfrutar ahora de un periodo tranquilo y divertido gracias a la influencia de Venus, tu regente, que se dirige hacia tu casa tercera. Números de suerte: 13, 6, 28.
Cuidarte al gastar el dinero ya que no estarás muy práctico al invertir el mismo. Cuando Venus se ubica en tu casa del dinero esto puede traer cosas positivas o dificultades. Venus atraerá hacia ti ganancias materiales. Surgirán oportunidades financieras, pero el problema se creará por tu tendencia a exagerar y ser algo extravagante. Números de suerte: 23, 49, 35.
Venus se mueve hoy hacia tu primera casa, la que rige tu personalidad. Este tránsito marca un periodo en el cual Venus va a afectar la manera en cómo te expresas o te proyectas hacia los demás. Serás tú ahora el que lleve la paz donde hay discordia. Vas a evadir todo lo que sea conflicto. Será una delicia estar y compartir contigo. Números de suerte: 18, 50, 8.
Venus, en tu casa doce, despierta en ti los deseos de hacer el bien a los demás. Te sentirás muy inclinado a llevar a cabo obras de caridad, a ayudar a aquel que necesite de ti. Te causará placer ayudar incondicionalmente a la persona que amas. Cuídate, sin embargo, de que otros se aprovechen de ti. No permitas que abusen de tu buen corazón. Números de suerte: 37, 12, 48.
Acuario
(19 de ene. - 17 de feb.)
Las relaciones en tu vida serán unas donde la amistad será la que te lleve al amor. Excelente periodo para disfrutar de toda actividad en grupo, especialmente con tus amistades. Estarás dispuesto a hacer compromisos y complacer, porque así lo quieres, a los demás. Todo trabajo en grupo será exitoso. Números de suerte: 49, 9, 13.
Piscis
(18 de feb. - 19 de marzo)
Trabajarás en armonía con los demás. Nada ni nadie podrá perturbar tu paz. Venus crea un ambiente favorable alrededor de tu trabajo o profesión. Atraerás hacia ti personas y circunstancias que harán tu trabajo más fácil y placentero. Podrás influenciar favorablemente a personas de autoridad como lo son jefes o superiores. Números de suerte: 30, 2, 11.

author: Eamonn Sheridan
title: OpenAI's Sam Altman says will add tens of thousands of GPUs next week
text:
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman on the lunch of the next iteration of ChatGPT.
- GPT-4.5 the largest and most powerful model to date
- model will be "giant" and "expensive."
- we've been growing a lot and are out of GPUs
- We will add tens of thousands of GPUs next week and roll it out to the plus tier then."
Altman trying single-handedly to reboot the AI-driven stock market rally?
Only kidding. He doesn't have a chance against tariff man's ramblings.
Altman info via Twitter:

author: Business Today Desk
title: Rain and thunderstorms likely over central, east, south India till May 13: IMD - BusinessToday
text: Heatwave in India: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted a wet spell accompanied with thunderstorms, lightning and gusty winds over central, east and south peninsular India till May 13. While heatwave conditions continued in certain parts of the country, very heavy rainfall occurred too. Temperatures soared in some parts of West Rajasthan, with Phalodi witnessing the highest maximum temperature of 46 degree Celsius. However, very heavy rainfall was witnessed at isolated places over Tamil Nadu, Kerala and heavy rainfall occurred at isolated places over Rayalaseema, Gangetic West Bengal and South Interior Karnataka. Some places in Madhya Pradesh and certain isolated places in Himachal Pradesh, Vidarbha and Jharkhand witnessed hailstorm activity too. Related ArticlesRain prediction: Moderate rainfall in many regions in coming 7 days, says IMD; check detailsBengaluru Rain: Airport's Terminal 2 flooded, 17 flights diverted to Chennai as heavy downpour lash the cityHeatwave days highest this April in 15 years in Gangetic West Bengal: IMDRAINFALL PREDICTIONDue to a cyclonic circulation over north Bihar and another over northeast Assam, widespread light to moderate rainfall accompanied with thunderstorm, lightning and squally winds are expected over West Bengal and Sikkim during May 10 to 12, while scattered rainfall with thunderstorm and gusty winds are expected over Bihar, Jharkhand during May 10-12, and over Odisha during May 10-14.Heavy rainfall is also likely over Gangetic West Bengal on May 11 and over Odisha duringMay 10-12.Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura are expected to witness fairly widespread light to moderate rainfall, along with thunderstorm, lightning and gusty winds during the next seven days. On May 10, Assam and Meghalaya are expected to witness isolated heavy rainfall. Vidarbha, Madhya Maharashtra, Marathwada and Chhattisgarh during May 10-14 period, Madhya Pradesh during May 9-11 are expected to witness scattered rainfall and thunderstorm due to a cyclonic circulation over central Madhya Pradesh and an east-west trough from northwest Rajasthan to south Assam.Madhya Pradesh is likely to experience thunderstorms, lightning and gusty winds during May 10-13. Meanwhile, hailstorm activity is also expected in Madhya Pradesh during May 10-13, over Vidarbha on May 12 and 13, over Madhya Maharashtra on May 11 and 12, and over Marathwada on May 12. Jammu-Kashmir-Ladakh-Gilgit-Baltistan-Muzaffarabad, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand regions are expected to witness scattered to fairly widespread rainfall activity with thunderstorm, lightning and gusty winds on May 10-13 period due to a cyclonic circulation over Iran and a cyclonic circulation over northwest Rajasthan.Hailstorm activity is also expected at isolated places over Jammu-Kashmir-Ladakh-Gilgit-Baltistan-Muzaffarabad on May 10 and 11, over Himachal Pradesh on May 10, over Uttarakhand on May 10-13. Isolated heavy rainfall is also expected in the region on May 12. Haryana-Chandigarh, Punjab, Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan regions are also expected to witness isolated to scattered light to moderate rainfall with thunderstorm, lightning and gusty winds on May 10-13.

author: DARCarvalho
title: Erro ao abrir o jogo EAFC 25
text:
uma hora atrás
Produto: EA SPORTS FC 25
Plataforma:PC
Por favor indique o modelo da sua plataforma. EA app - PC
Número do modelo AMD ou Nvidia NVIDIA MSI RTX 2070 SUPER
Insira o tamanho da memória RAM em GB 16gb
Em qual modo isso aconteceu? Modo Carreira
Qual modo de jogo? Carreira Treinador
Com que frequência o erro ocorre? 100%
Como podemos encontrar o erro? É ao abrir o jogo.
O que acontece? Sempre que início o jogo, parece-me o seguinte erro: Directx error. "GetDeviceRemovedReason" failed with DXGI_ERROR_DEVICE_HUNG (The GPU Will not respond to more commands). GPU NVIDIA GeForce GTX 2070 super Drivers:56614. Thais error os usually caused by The graphics drivers crashing; try installing The last drivers.
O que deveria acontecer?
Já atualizei a drivers da GPU.
Com outros jogos da EA não me acontece este problema, inclusive com eawrc jogo perfeitamente. Só o EAFC é que começou ter este problema
Vamos confirmar se realmente é você enviando um código para seus dispositivos de confiança.
Tente essas etapas e descarte os problemas que você possa ter ao se conectar a um jogo da EA.

author: Isabelle Parkin
title: 'It was meant to be!': Leap year babies born at Walsall and Wolverhampton hospitals | Express & Star
text: 'It was meant to be!': Leap year babies born at Walsall and Wolverhampton hospitals It was a day of unique births at hospitals in Wolverhampton and Walsall after more than half a dozen babies arrived on a leap day. First to arrive at Walsall Manor Hospital on February 29 was a baby boy, still to be named, to mum Oluwaseun Adeleye and partner Adebisi Adeleye. Tipping the scales at 8lb 8oz, the leap year baby is a little brother to Ewalfeoluwa, aged six. Oluwaseun, aged 30, who is a staff nurse on Ward 14 at the hospital, said: "It is special anyway but we will have an extra special celebration in four years’ time. "We will celebrate his birthday every year though." Also celebrating a unique birthday was George Thomas Paddock, who arrived to first-time parents Louise and Tom Paddock, at 11.37am. George, who weighed 8lbs 4oz, was due to be born on Friday but was delivered early by caesarean section because of his size. Louise, aged 29, from Willenhall, said: "I initially panicked because people were saying it was going to be a leap year baby. "But then this was the only day they could fit my caesarean in so I thought it was meant to be and everyone reassured us it was a special day." New dad Tom also shared his joy. He added: "The date doesn’t matter to me – just that he’s healthy. We’ll celebrate his birthday on the 28th and then every four years, when he can have two birthdays." Both families are looking forward to taking their new arrivals home soon. Walsall Healthcare NHS Trust midwives Jess Blowen and Ayokunmi Apeyiomo were part of the delivery team for both babies and were delighted to share the joy of the unusual occasion. Ayokunmi, who has been a midwife for 14 years, said: "It was lovely – the babies are strong boys. "George cried when he came out and we had to do a bit of resuscitation, so just when we thought we’d have to go to neonatal, he settled down and he could stay with his mum and dad." Jess, who has been a midwife for more than four years, added that it was a "privilege" to help deliver the new arrivals. Meanwhile, six leap day babies were welcomed at Wolverhampton's New Cross Hospital. The first bundle of joy to arrive at exactly 40 weeks was Leyton Pickett, who was born at 2.07am to first-time parents Jade Pickett and husband Roger. Jade, who is from Wolverhampton, said: "He was born exactly on his due date. It is very special that he was born on a leap year. He will be forever young." Kelly Arthur and Dean Willoughby, from Pendeford, were the next to celebrate a unique birth after daughter Lottie was born at 10am by caesarean section, weighing 5lb 5oz. Kelly, a pre-school nursery supervisor, said: “I was worried when I realised she was going to be born on a leap year but now I think it is very unique and super special. “We have been trying to decide what day to celebrate her birthday on. Her older sister Brooke, 11, was born in February so we may pick March 1 for Lottie so they have their birthday on separate months.”

author: Redazione Web
title: Cold Christmas Forecast with Polar Air Influx
text: We are likely to have a cold Christmas. According to projections, "during the holidays, a polar air intrusion might take hold. Very cold air from Northern Europe could descend in latitude and reach Italy," meteorologist Mattia Gussoni from Il Meteo.it told Adnkronos. Heavy Rain in Rome Today: Where and When It Will Rain - Weekend Weather Forecast The Bad Weather Let's start with the coming days: "Between Friday and Saturday, we will have a wave of bad weather, particularly in the central-southern regions. Thunderstorms will return and will be particularly intense, especially on the Tyrrhenian side. It might also snow in the Apennines at altitudes above 1,400 meters. Additionally, on Sunday, very strong winds from the northern quadrants will promote a drop in temperatures in the same areas. In the North, however, we will have more stable weather, but fog is expected in the plains, and temperatures will remain quite low even during the day," explains Gussoni. The Trend for Christmas "For the entire next week, the scene across Central-Western Europe and the Mediterranean basin will be dominated by high pressure. This means stable weather in Italy: no precipitation and rather mild temperatures, especially in the central-southern regions. In the week leading up to Christmas, we will therefore have decidedly sunnier days." This leads to the holidays, which will see a reversal of the trend. "Of course, we still need to wait a few days for the details," Gussoni notes, "but projections suggest that around Christmas, there will be a return of bad weather, low temperatures, and snow down to low altitudes."

author: Leonardo Nunes
title: Conheça o primeiro robô humanoide para tarefas domésticas, o NEO Gamma
text:
Um robô humanoide inovador, o NEO Gamma, foi lançado para realizar tarefas domésticas, como servir café, limpar janelas, passar aspirador e auxiliar no transporte de compras. A proposta é liberar as pessoas para se concentrarem em atividades mais significativas, enquanto o robô cuida das tarefas diárias. O lançamento é da 1X Technologies, renomada no campo da inteligência artificial e robótica.
O NEO Gamma é uma demonstração impressionante de tecnologia avançada, capaz de imitar movimentos humanos, como andar, balançar os braços, agachar para pegar objetos e até mesmo sentar em cadeiras. Além disso, o robô foi desenvolvido para interagir de forma natural com os usuários, tornando a experiência mais intuitiva e amigável.
Quais são as características do NEO Gamma?
O corpo do NEO Gamma é revestido com um tecido macio, garantindo segurança durante as interações e proporcionando movimentos suaves e silenciosos. A tecnologia de tendões mecânicos permite que seus passos se assemelhem aos de um ser humano, aumentando a naturalidade de seus movimentos. Equipado com quatro microfones e um sistema de três alto-falantes, o robô é capaz de realizar interações de voz e emitir efeitos sonoros em 360 graus, além de tocar música.
Essas características fazem do NEO Gamma uma ferramenta multifuncional, capaz de se adaptar a diferentes ambientes e necessidades. A presença de alto-falantes estrategicamente posicionados permite uma comunicação clara e eficaz, enquanto os microfones garantem que o robô possa captar comandos de forma precisa.
Como o NEO Gamma pode transformar o cotidiano?
O lançamento do NEO Gamma representa um avanço significativo na forma como as tarefas domésticas são realizadas. Com a capacidade de executar uma variedade de funções, o robô promete transformar o cotidiano, oferecendo mais tempo livre para que as pessoas possam se dedicar a atividades mais importantes ou simplesmente relaxar. A possibilidade de interagir de maneira natural com o robô também adiciona um elemento de conveniência e modernidade ao ambiente doméstico.
Além disso, a 1X Technologies acredita que os robôs humanoides devem viver e aprender entre os humanos para desenvolver inteligência e compreender as nuances da experiência de vida. Essa filosofia reflete o compromisso da empresa em criar tecnologias que não apenas auxiliem nas tarefas diárias, mas também contribuam para um futuro mais integrado entre humanos e máquinas.
O que esperar do futuro dos robôs humanoides?
Embora a 1X Technologies ainda não tenha divulgado o preço e a data de lançamento do NEO Gamma, a expectativa em torno do produto é alta. O desenvolvimento de robôs humanoides como o NEO Gamma sinaliza um futuro onde a automação e a inteligência artificial desempenham papéis cada vez mais centrais em nossas vidas. À medida que essas tecnologias continuam a evoluir, é provável que vejamos uma integração ainda maior entre humanos e máquinas, com robôs desempenhando funções cada vez mais complexas e essenciais.
O NEO Gamma é apenas o começo de uma nova era na robótica, onde a convivência harmoniosa entre humanos e robôs pode se tornar uma realidade cotidiana. Com o avanço contínuo da tecnologia, o potencial para transformar a maneira como vivemos e trabalhamos é imenso, prometendo um futuro onde a colaboração entre humanos e máquinas é não apenas possível, mas desejável.

author: Elina Tarkazikis,Scripps News Staff
title: Hundreds arrested across US campuses as pro-Palestinian protesters clash with police
text: Across colleges in the United States, students are leading protests against the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas, as well as institutional ties between universities and Israel. These protests have prompted the deployment of law enforcement, resulting in the arrests of hundreds of students and some injured officers. Over 100 people were arrested at Emerson College as pro-Palestinian protesters clashed with police. The Boston Police Department confirmed the arrests of 108 people at Emerson and said four officers were injured in the clashes.Three of those officers have minor injuries and one is more serious, police said. The incident happened in the early hours of Thursday morning at an encampment set up by students to show solidarity with pro-Palestinian protesters arrested at Columbia University last week, according to local outlet [WCVB](https://www.wcvb.com/article/boston-police-arrest-protesters-clear-pro-palestinian-encampment-at-emerson-college/60600586). Police said no protesters in custody were injured, and that they will be arraigned at Boston Municipal Court. In Atlanta, several protesters were detained Thursday during demonstrations at Emory University. According to [The Emory Wheel](https://emorywheel.com/emory-community-ashamed-after-police-detain-students-at-pro-palestine-encampment/), the school's newspaper, campus police alongside the Atlanta Police Department and Georgia State Patrol started using gas and arresting protesters at around 10:15 a.m. While the number of people arrested in Atlanta is not yet known, we do know that some of the protesters detained were faculty members. Around noon, local reporter Patrick Quinn from Atlanta News First [posted a video](https://x.com/PatrickQuinnTV/status/1783532600637681964) showing the apprehension of Noelle McAfee, the chair of the Philosophy Department at Emory University. Georgia Rep. Ruwa Romman took to [social media](https://x.com/Ruwa4Georgia/status/1783573832348885439) to call out the police for using excessive force in these arrests. “The use of extreme anti-riot tactics by Georgia State Patrol, including tasers and gas, is a dangerous escalation to protests which were by all accounts peaceful and nonviolent,” said Romman. “We cannot allow this dangerous repression to continue.” Also early on Thursday, the Los Angeles Police Department [reported]( https://x.com/LAPDHQ/status/1783359964305871250) that they had arrested 93 people during Wednesday's demonstrations at the University of Southern California. Fortunately, there were no reports of injuries. Following the protests, [USC announced](https://commencement.usc.edu/2024/04/25/commencement-update-april-25-2024/) that they would be canceling their main stage graduation ceremony, an event that usually hosts over 65,000 people, due to security concerns. In Indiana, police officers have arrested multiple demonstrators at Indiana University, with the [American Civil Liberties Union reporting](https://x.com/ACLUIndiana/status/1783596245795164304) that they are monitoring the situation. They emphasized, "The First Amendment is central to our democracy. Suppressing these rights through unwarranted police action weakens our society's commitment to free speech." These protests follow a pattern of rallies happening on college campuses nationwide. On Wednesday, police at the University of Texas at Austin detained over 50 demonstrators, with officers pushing and aggressively detaining some, according to [The Daily Texan](https://thedailytexan.com/2024/04/24/students-faculty-law-enforcement-clash-at-pro-palestine-protest/). In the case of Columbia University, classes went virtual after recent protests in an effort to "deescalate the rancor" over the humanitarian crisis following the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza and address security concerns on campus amid the Jewish holiday of Passover.
